channel.title: Casey's Technology Blog And Projects
channel.description: Feel free to contact me. The opinions on this site do not reflect the opinions of my employer.

item.title: 8 Queens Puzzle in Go (GoLang)
item.description:
I am currently in the process of evaluating GO, and one of the excersizes I always do when learning a new language is to implement the 8 queens puzzle, which is an old computational exercise to determine how many different combinations of 8 queens can be placed on a Chess board (which is 8 x 8 squares) in positions which they cannot attach each other.

In computer science this problem is most often implemented as nQueens, meaning n Queens on an n x n board. To read more about the problem see here.

Implementing this in GO was extremely easy, and fast. I didn’t do any performance calculations, but compared to previous interations I’ve done in C++, C#, Java, and others this version seems to perform the best. You can run an example on the Go Playground

Here is the source code on GitHub:

item.title: Say Hello!
item.description:
This is the first post to my new blog. I am going to talk about some of the things I am passionate about in technology, coding, etc. I will also create pages for my ever growing list of open source projects and code snippets on Github that I am working on.

Here you will find topics on:

  • HTML5, Angular, React.js, Backbone, and Polymer.
  • Mobile Development
  • PhoneGap
  • Scrum and Agile
  • Node.js
  • The Go Language

I am also very interested in machine learning and data science so there will stuff about that, and whatever else strikes my fancy.
